title: Skewered Tuna with Orange
introduction: Enjoy a taste of Sicily with Skewered Tuna with Orange. This delightful dish marries the robust flavors of fresh tuna with the zesty sweetness of grilled oranges and fresh herbs. Each bite brings the aroma and taste of the Mediterranean, perfect for a spring or summer barbecue.
ingredients: 1½ pounds fresh tuna, swordfish, or salmon steaks (about 1 inch thick)
1 small red onion, cut into 16 pieces
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Cut the tuna into 1½-inch chunks. In a large bowl, toss the tuna, orange, and red onion pieces with the olive oil, lemon juice, rosemary, and salt and pepper to taste.
Place the barbecue grill or broiler rack about 5 inches from the heat source. Preheat the grill or broiler.
Thread the tuna, orange pieces, onion, and bay leaves alternately on 8 skewers.

Broil or grill until the tuna is browned, about 3 to 4 minutes. Turn the skewers and cook until browned on the outside but still pink in the center, about 2 minutes more, or until done to taste. Serve hot.
